message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.DC, cs.NI, cs.SI. 

This paper deals with the design of codes for efficient data storage and repair, which is a topic closely related to information theory (cs.IT). The paper also involves the analysis and optimization of algorithms for data storage and repair, which falls under the categories of distributed systems (cs.DS) and distributed computing (cs.DC). The paper also discusses the use of piggybacking to reduce repair bandwidth, which is a technique commonly used in networked systems (cs.NI) and communication systems (cs.SI).
